DOC.brief_summary: The investigators would like to find out if AESCULONÂ®, a new device that non-invasively and continuously measures cardiac output using electrical cardiometry, works as well as one existing method--Fick method in patients undergoing cardiopulmonary exercise testing.
DOC.brief_title: Validation of Electrical Cardiometry Versus Fick Method in Cardiac Output Measurement
DOC.criteria: Age >= 18 yd; Level 3 cardiopulmonary exercise testing. Proven or suspected disease involving severe aortic regurgitation; Implanted with a rateresponsive cardiac pacemaker; Pneumothorax or pleural effusion; Skin lesion(s) at the place where the electrode is supposed to be applied; Allergic to adhesive of ECG electrodes.
